title: Novelty: Optimizing StreamingLLM for Novel Plot Generation
abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) struggle with the task of long-form creative writing both technically, by exhibiting undesired behavior when the context length exceeds its training sequence length, and creatively, by producing bland plots that do not develop a coherent or engaging story. While very large models with long context lengths such as GPT-4 have made strides in this area, we aim to optimize for creativity and diversity of natural language generation with computational constraints and a small underlying context window of 4k tokens. We introduce the novel approach of treating novel-writing as a streaming "question-answer" chapter-generating conversation between user and assistant. We produce perceptible improvements in model creativity by building a rich novel plot generation model through fine-tuning Vicuna-7b with StreamingLLM on chapter-by-chapter detailed plot summaries. We also demonstrate that different training data formats and prompt engineering at inference time can produce greater diversity of output and help prevent repetitive rabbit-holing.

tldr.text: The novel approach of treating novel-writing as a streaming "question-answer" chapter-generating conversation between user and assistant is introduced and perceptible improvements in model creativity are produced by building a rich novel plot generation model through fine-tuning Vicuna-7b with StreamingLLM on chapter-by-chapter detailed plot summaries.
